course.title: The Python Mega Course: Build 10 Real World Applications
course.subtitle: A complete practical Python course for both beginners & intermediates! Master Python 3 by making 10 amazing Python apps.

reviews.body: Course spent too much time on basics - like python basics, tkinter basics, flask basics, etc. - resulting on less time for conceptually explaining things like OO python, tkinter approach to UI, flask approach to web ui, etc.

I have accomplished my course and enjoyed every lecture. The 10 Real World Applications were all immensely satisfying! (I enjoyed the 6th application the most utmost) I urge you to attempt this course if you are studying Python as a beginner or intermediate. Ardit Sulce is a transcendent instructor and appreciations and thankfulness for developing this course! Also acknowledgements to the community and teaching assistant(David) for the amazing support and assistance! What an ascent!

Overall you get the grasp of Python. However, lots of outdated content, some programs don't work, instructor switches to different application in the middle of the course, some questions remain unanswered while various explanations are not very clear.

When instructor makes mistakes, he doesn't even bother to reupload the clean video, instead add notes, in some instances there were over 2 notes and additional comments added. Such a mess.

This course is a good introduction to Python but be aware of unclear explanations, program not installing and ultimately there will be errors in your code and YOU WILL HAVE TO SOLVE THEM on your own.!

-Zufrieden-

Es gibt an einigen Stellen Verbesserungspotential, aber im Gro√üen und Ganzen wird einem Wissen vermittelt, welches der Kursbeschreibung entspricht.

I finished the course and here is my thought.

I would say this course goes beyond my expectation. There is some part more interesting to me than the others.

However, it's very nice to learn and see what Python can do. All modules in this course help building your python skill as a programmer.

The apps that we made are proper in term of complexity, difficulty, and time limit. This course really get your hands dirty. It's a real learning by practicing course and not simply syntax learning.

I also like instructor's manner. He is quite funny and easy to listen to. You will see many errors happening here and there in this course. Personally, I think it's not a bad thing because you see how to fix it (or google) and be familiar with the exceptions which is part of programming job..fixing bugs or try out solutions.

Last but not the least is Q&A support, I would say it's second to none. Course Assistant is super supportive and respond in short time. He does pay attention to help and give advices to students.

Thank you Ardit for such a big amazing course and David for your kind support to students.

I look forward for The Python Mega Course: Season2!

Just right for me. I think some of it would be a little daunting for complete beginners because things change so rapidly. I have a little experience and while I found some things challenging, I find that this is good for proper learning. An excellent course.
The course covers a wide variety of information. While some parts of the videos may be outdated due to time, solutions can be easily found in the Q&A.

If u are someone who is curious about how the websites and applications on your device works and how to build them...this course is highly recommended for u. From Hello World to building ur own applications this is a very interesting journey.If u are already familiar with basic concept of any programing language that would be beneficial for u coz i feel the basics section could be more elaborated.

p.s-writing this review after completing the course.
course is really really excellent and helped me a lot in better understanding of python and its real world application.Thankyou so much for this wonderfull course Mr.Ardict
This is the best python course. I liked it very much as well as i have learned so much about python.

I really enjoyed this course. Every video was sectioned nice and short. Enough to make sure you get whatever was presented. I upped my skill by 200% doing this course.

Well done Ardit!

A very good course with a very good and pedagogic instructor.

The connection to Real World Applications is very valueable.

instructor.name: Ardit Sulce
instructor.briefIntroduction:
Hi, I am Ardit! I am a Python programmer and a Python teacher. I have worked with companies from many countries both as an employee and as self-employed. I have used Python as a data science tool and a language to develop both desktop and web applications. Some of the projects I have worked on have been using Python together with the Center for Conservation Geography to map and understand the Australian ecosystems, process drone land images with the Swiss in-Terra, and performing data mining to gain business insights with the Australian Rapid Intelligence.


I will teach you how you can use Python, just like I do. I take care to explain the programming concepts assuming my students don't have a computer science background. Indeed, you don't need a computer science degree to become a programmer.

I was graduated with a Master of Science in Geospatial Technologies from the University of Muenster in Germany. I am also the founder and author of PythonHow, a Python learning resource designed particularly for people with no previous programming experience. Try out one of my courses, and you will be on for an exciting ride.
